alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 3:52PM MDT until July 21 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 430 PM MDT. * At 352 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near El Porvenir, or 11 miles northwest of Las Vegas, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Las Vegas, Romeroville, Montezuma, El Porvenir, Storrie Lake State Park, Sapello, San Agustin, Manuelitas, Los Montoyas and Gallinas. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 336 and 354. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 1 and 11. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 5. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 11. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 1 and 13. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
